moves.1. e4 c5: Sicilian. A basic one for me.
moves.2. d4 cxd4: Just as it's suposed to be played.
moves.4. Qc4: Huh. That isn't normal (well at least not to me)
moves.5. Nf3: I have allready pulled out my knight, so I am safe.
moves.5... Nf6 6. Ng5: He threatens to play Kxf7 and fork my queen and rook.
moves.7. Nc3 Qb4: I try to have a queen trade...
moves.8. Qxf7+: but instead he attacks with the queen!
moves.8... Kd8: I run away, spoiling my chances of castling.
moves.9. a3 Qe7: I want to trade, even though I am down in material.
moves.13. Nxd4: And he takes, puting me in position to scare the othe knight on c3 away.
moves.13... exd4 14. Nb5 Nxe4: Evening out material by taking both the middle and a hanging piece.
moves.15... d6 16. Bg2: He doesn't like my knight there.
moves.17. Bxe4: But he doesn't like it so he takes it.
moves.17... dxe4 18. O-O g5: advancing pawns to release the bishop
moves.23. Nd4+: He decides to check me again.
moves.23... Kd5 24. f3: He suports his rook, but now his king is vunarable.
moves.24... Bxd4+: Check him and after a free rook!!
moves.25. Rxd4+: Desperado sacrifice. I would have done the same.
moves.25... Kxd4 26. Bb2+: Skewer for Bxh8. Okay with me. I'll still be a point ahead.
moves.28. Rf1: An attempt to stop my bishop.
moves.28... Bxf1 29. Kxf1: Now I begin to see a rook mate.
moves.29... Kxf3 30. c4: Rd8 should be a death sentence for white.
moves.30... Rd8 31. b5: And he fails to see the mate.
moves.31... Rd1#: And Checkmate is acheved! A wild game all the way through to the final move.
